channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 3 bags dumped on the pavement on Manor Way and Magpie Hall Lane., 16th July
item.description:
The bags have been causing an obstruction for over a week, it’s just another issue that is ongoing beside No 38 Manor Way, which is in a shocking state and needs professional cleaning and fumigation. The pavement never gets cleaned and the garden is shocking. Would someone please help? It’s becoming unbearable and makes our area look like a tip.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Way, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees behind the garden need complete triming., 16th July
item.description:
The trees branches are too many coming on the garden space and need to be completely trimed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whimbrel Close, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped bags, flytip, 16th July
item.description:
This was previously reported to Bromley council last week but they have closed report as could they could locate it. The flytip is still there, and have to walk in the road to avoid it. It’s outside 38 Manor Way, the house on the corner of that has a lot of other rubbish.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Way, Southborough, London

item.title: Over flowing bin with dog excrement, 16th July
item.description:
The bin hasn’t been emptied in weeks and is overflowing with dog waste bags.Its an absolute health hazard and a danger to the school children that access it to go to school and back. Please could someone address this asap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Magpie Hall Lane, Bromley Common, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree Roots causing structural damage, 16th July
item.description:
The roots of this tree are damaging the structure of my wall, driveway and even house. This has been an issue we have previously reported with no followup from the council. The crack in the wall has worsen over the last year and having recently removed gravel from the driveway it has exposed that the tree roots are coming up through the drive. Additionally, we are seriously concerned the roots are damaging the house as we've notice several new big cracks over the past 6 months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hollies Avenue, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Brockley Hall Road and pavement needs weeding, 16th July
item.description:
Weeds have now grown to a point where they are a trip hazard, please fix before someone gets hurt.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockley Hall Road, Brockley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti in several places, 16th July
item.description:
In Parkhill road just passes the park on the left near the church there is graffiti its all the way along Parkhill road and down towards The Anchor public house in Blendon road, all the street bins, lamposts BT boxes have graffiti on them its the same tag on all of them its not offensive, its even on someones garden wall. please can this be dealt with as will only get worse
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 29, Parkhill Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bins on the street, 16th July
item.description:
The bins have been left on the street outside of the property and are overflowing. They are also causing an obstruction to the pavement eg difficult to walk pass with a pram etc. these bins have been like for at least a week.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): West Bank, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown shrub encroaching on drop kerb, 16th July
item.description:
The shrub is overgrown and encroaching on the drop kerb reducing access for wheelchair and pram users. The shrub doesn't need to be removed (we love the garden area!) just trimmed a bit.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Penpoll Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Historical Fly Tipping, 16th July
item.description:
My tenant has informed me that there is alot of old fly tipping that has been left to rot down the communal alley way. She is now having a heavy rodent issue due to this as apparently a chicken coup was dumped there (with loads of other things). I have asked for photos but the fly tipping is now covered in ivy so pictures do not show barely anything. Please can you send someone down to clear this as its also obstructing access, if there was to ever be a fire.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chequers Court, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Enormous dog poo outside 18 Hamilton Gardens, 16th July
item.description:
PLease can someone come and clean up the mess. THank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Hamilton Gardens, St. John's Wood, London

item.title: Overhanging hedges alongside the whole of Danson Sports Ground and fences that have been put up on the entrance to Danson Sports Ground on Perry Street are causing access problems, 16th July
item.description:
Overhanging hedges alongside the whole of Danson Sports Ground and fences that have been put up on the entrance to Danson Sports Ground on Perry Street are causing access problems causing a registered blind man to have to walk into the road to get past - please can this be looked into asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Street, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown Tree from Private (unoccupied) house blocking walkway, 16th July
item.description:
The house at 171 Shirland Road is boarded up and appears unoccupied. The tree in the front yard has grown significantly and is now blocking the walkway with pedestrians having to duck under the branches to walk down the road. I think it needs to be cut-back for safety reasons.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 173, Shirland Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet
